result.execSummary:
The defendant Tonya M Frye was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Use Anti-Theft Remover (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Tonya M Frye
parties.address: 2323 S 32nd St Unit A, Milwaukee, WI 53215

supervisions.notes: Fine/DNA Sucharge to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 11/15/2016 or penalty of 5 days Huber for non-payment.
Restitution in the amount of $7.00 to be paid to Sports Authority within 2 weeks.  Review Hearing scheduled for Novermber 3, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.

If restitution is paid within 2 weeks, the court will waive the $200.00 DNA Surcharge and amend the DNA Surcharge.
AMENDED 11/2/2016:  DNA SURCHAGE WAIVED.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: Restitution paid, Amend JOC, remove $200.00 DNA surchage per Judge's order.
Restitution paid.
Review hearing on November 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Tonya M Frye in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Defendant still owes $7.00 in restitution as stated on the record.  Community service completed.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Weitzner makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following to count #1:

FINE: $379.00 

Restitution:  $7.00 due to sports authority, to be paid within 2 weeks.  

DNA Surcharge: $200.00.  If the $7.00 restitution is paid within 2 weeks, the court will waive the $200.00 DNA surcharge and amend the JOC.  

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 11/15/2016.  Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 5 days in Huber 

Court schedules review hearing to see if restitution has been paid.  Review hearing scheduled for November 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court.   Defendant Tonya M Frye did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weitzner makes statements regarding the nonappearance of his client.  Court schedules this matter for Tuesday at 8:30 am for a plea hearing.  Court takes the matter off of the trial calendar.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received September 20, 2016,   State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on October 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tonya M Frye in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weitzner was just given a pretrial offer today.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Hearing on July 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Motion to forfeit bail granted.

Defendant Tonya M Frye in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Next date is the deadline to file motions.  Hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint. Defendant to not use any theft device remover.

Defendant to have no contact with witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Not to use or possess any theft detection device remover.  Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.
